item.title: Fibonacci
item.description: Problem Source: Codeforces Find the $n^th$ Fibonacci number modulo $10^9+7$. So, you need to find $F_n$ in the sequence defined as $$ \begin{aligned} F_0 & = 0\\ F_1 & = 1\\ F_i & = F_{i-1} + F_{i-2} (i >= 2) \end{aligned} $$ Example: Input: 50 Output: 586268941 Solution Approach 1: Dynamic Programing Using fibonacci’s difference equation as a recurrence relation, i can write to a program like this: int f0 = 0, f1 = 1, fn; for(int i = 2; i <= n; i++){ fn = f0 + f1; f0 = f1; f1 = fn; } return fn; This code’s complexity is $O(n)$ which is fine with $n <= 5.
